reviews.review_msg: The easiest class i've ever had! However, don't expect you can learn a whole lot from this class coz you only need to have the basic knowledge from the lower level educ classes. i admit that i didn't study the text at all but still manage to get an A. Recommended to any lazy student like me.

Disliked this class so much that I stopped going. The first 30mins of every class was monopolized by certain students agruing with prof over course content and direction. A lot of lecturing, textbooks were boring, class 4hours long and most of the material I learned in first year psychology class. I don't feel I got anything valuable from this clas
i recommend taking this course with this prof, she's very nice and understanding, topics covered are interesting, textbooks are not hard to read...

Although it is a "seminar" course, she makes it seem like a lecture class. So if you don't want to talk, there isn't a pressure. Her classes can be boring but her exams are super easy. She tells you what to study for and there are no surprises in her exam. Take her class. It could be your GPA booster!

Lisa, is a really nice person. She is highly educated (she went to harvard!). However, classes where extremely boring and you learn very little. Just read the book, and you will be fine. She means really well. Fantastic lady!

she is the reason why university profs should have a teaching degree! she can not teach! very unclear. shes confused all the time, very disorganized, doesn't listen to the students and keeping pushing her put. talks about how educated she is! doesnt seem to understand what she is trying to teach. AVOID HER! I warned you!

OMG! I cant believe they let her teach! She talks about how she went to NY film academy all the time. She is disorganized and can not teach. Very confusing to understand what her expectations are for the exams, in class activities or research paper. She doesn't listen and is very Confused! do not take a class with her!!

Karen was an excellent prof! She responded quickly to emails, provided feedback, and ensured that expectations were clear. There is a large research project, but she was very supportive throughout the process.

Karen is such a kind and genuine instructor. You can tell she cares about her students - this course does have a lot of reading (hence being 4 credits), but the course is laid out so it's easy to navigate and assignments are well divided up.

Karen is hands down the best prof I've had at SFU. There is a large research project for this course (50% of your grade) and she was there every step of the way whenever I had questions or concerns. She replies to emails quickly and is very kind and understanding. I can't recommend her highly enough!
She is so kind and nice, not a tough grader, just take her class. 100% recommended.
